title: Mario engine to Keen conversion
content:
Now you might know that in Game Maker community there is a Mario engine (full platform engine, open source, bug free, including all the mario games, enemies and features).
just search "Mario Bros 3 Engine 6.1 beta.gm6"

It's basically Keen engine beside the pogo.
How hard will it be to convert it to keen graphics (the answer is easy+ adding my keen GM project code for more player actions), and making the enemies (that many of them can already simulate exisitng keen enemies) to keen enemies AI?
It can be better than making an engine from scratch.

title: Re: Mario engine to Keen conversion
content:
If a Mario engine basically plays like a Keen engine, the creator did something wrong along the way. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

It might or might not be better than making it from scratch, depending on how well-coded it is and how much you understand of it. And how extendable it is. If it's not good at any of those, you might be better off making an engine from scratch.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Mario engine to Keen conversion
content:
Well, it's Game Maker, so it's as extendable as you can get.
I agree that there are differences between keen and mario engine (including running speed, jump height etc...), but those are easily configurable, as it's (again) open sourced and those stuff are pretty parametrized, and even if not - can be parametrized.

title: Re: Mario engine to Keen conversion
content:
But both are platform engines so you don't need to make one from scratch, including jumping, climbing (for keen 4-6) , running etc... Enemies AI can be easily adjustable to fit keenAI (as there are plenty of enemies (26 to be exact), some of those sure can be good base for keen enemies), and new enemies can be made. Still, collision events and other usually buggy stuff are handled well there.
The engine is a bit heavy though.

title: Re: Mario engine to Keen conversion
content:
* It should provide a Keen: Galaxy style physics system.
* Should take advantage of modern Windows and GNU/Linux systems, via the Allegro programming library and built-in platform communication APIs.
* Should support a 4-planar tile-map format (the META Tile-map format), with a background tile plane, bimetric background tile plane, bimetric interaction tile plane and foreground tile plane.
* Should be extensible via game scripts (META scripts), so new games can be made using the same engine as base, abd the authors should not need advanced programming knowledge as the engine source code itself should not be modified for such creations.
* Should allow for extensible tilesets, with a reasonable size limit; the tilesets should be stored in 32-bit color PNGs, and their alpha channels should be processed.
* Should implement a parallax-scrolling engine.
* Should provide a particle and weather system.
* Should allow for almost unlimited spritesets, each one containing sprites, which may be actual game elements (creatures, enemies, etc.) by using an extensible actor AI engine.
* Should be compatible with the following music formats: WAV, Ogg Vorbis, MOD (ProTracker), S3M (Scream Tracker 3.x), XM (FastTracker), IT (Impulse Tracker).------------------------------
